asgn1Election

Class Candidate

  • java.lang.Object
    • asgn1Election.Candidate

  • public class Candidate
extends java.lang.Object

    Class defines information about a single candidate in an election: the name, full party name, party acronym and the number of votes received. This implementation is a simple record type.

    Two methods are supplied for display - the standard toString() - which includes name, party acronym and vote count - and candidateListing(), which includes the full party name.

    Author:
    hogan

    • Constructor Detail

      • Candidate

        public Candidate(java.lang.String candName,
         java.lang.String candParty,
         java.lang.String candAbbrev,
         int voteCount)
          throws ElectionException
        Constructor for the Candidate class numCandidates has meaning only w.r.t. a full asgn1Collection lexicon, and so requires keywords from across the collection for initialisation.
        Parameters:
        candName - String containing candidate name
        candParty - String containing full party name
        candAbbrev - String containing party acronym
        voteCount - int containing initial number of votes (usually 0).
        Throws:
        ElectionException - if isNullOrEmpty(candName,candParty,candAbbrev) OR voteCount <0

    • Method Detail

      • candidateListing

        public java.lang.String candidateListing()
        Display method to show candidate name, full party and party acronym. Note this representation does not include voteCount. See also toString()
        Returns:
        String with formatted candidate display
